item.title: Microbial quality of artisanal yoghurt and Dèguè products collected in schools of Cotonou and Abomey-Calavi (Benin)
item.description: The main aim of this study is to evaluate the microbiological quality of yoghurt and two types of dgu (couscous and millet) sold in Cotonou and Abomey-Calavi. Samples of dairy products were collected in 15 schools of Abomey-Calavi and Cotonou from vendors located inside the schools. item.description: Robusta coffee is known to be high yielding than Arabica coffee, since it is more vigorous in growth. However, it is limited by the inferior cup quality. item.description: Four types of protein sources were used in the preparation of pepper soup dishes using Itsekiri pepper soup spices were evaluated. item.description: In Senegal, sweet corn is produced for export market while the canned ones are imported to supply national market.
